did.head: Overview
did.abstract: These papers contain notices from the President's Office, 1916-1918, pertaining to grades for students leaving because of the military draft, alternate seating during exams, influenza epidemic, and student discipline; form letter and report for the 1903/04 year of the Students Guild Hospital; correspondence (largely incoming), 1909-1921 and 1946, pertaining to committee appointments and business, possibility of a tailor's shop at Fallen Leaf Lake for the Army Training camp, and a follow up on a speech by Mitchell in 1946; and assorted certificates and awards, 1944-71.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Sketch
bioghist.p: Mitchell, who earned his A.B. (1903), A.M. (1904), and Ph.D. (1907) from Stanford University, was Registrar and Professor of Chemistry.
